016package org.lifstools.jgoslin.domain;
017
018import java.util.Map;
019import java.util.TreeMap;
020
021/**
022 * An abstraction for double bond counts and positions.
023 *
024 * @author Dominik Kopczynski
025 * @author Nils Hoffmann
026 */
027public final class DoubleBonds {
028
029    private int numDoubleBonds;
030    protected final Map<Integer, String> doubleBondPositions;
031
032    public DoubleBonds() {
033        numDoubleBonds = 0;
034        doubleBondPositions = new TreeMap<>();
035    }
036
037    public DoubleBonds(int num) {
038        numDoubleBonds = num;
039        doubleBondPositions = new TreeMap<>();
040    }
041
042    public DoubleBonds(TreeMap<Integer, String> db) {
043        numDoubleBonds = db.size();
044        doubleBondPositions = db;
045    }
046
047    public DoubleBonds copy() {
048        DoubleBonds db = new DoubleBonds(numDoubleBonds);
049        doubleBondPositions.entrySet().forEach(kv -> {
050            db.doubleBondPositions.put(kv.getKey(), kv.getValue());
051        });
052        return db;
053    }
054
055    public int getNumDoubleBonds() {
056        if (doubleBondPositions.size() > 0 && doubleBondPositions.size() != numDoubleBonds) {
057            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Number of double bonds '" + Integer.toString(numDoubleBonds) + "' does not match to number of double bond positions '" + Integer.toString(doubleBondPositions.size()) + "'");
058        }
059        return numDoubleBonds;
060    }
061
062    public void setNumDoubleBonds(int numDoubleBonds) {
063        this.numDoubleBonds = numDoubleBonds;
064    }
065
066    public Map<Integer, String> getDoubleBondPositions() {
067        return doubleBondPositions;
068    }
069
070}
